title_sort: william sloane kennedy to walt whitman and horace traubel, 18 september 1888
title: William Sloane Kennedy to Walt Whitman and Horace Traubel, 18 September 1888
text: Mr. Sadakichi Hartmann will open his dramatic session with "Narcisse" on Monday, the twelfth of November. Mr. Hartmann played the part with great success in Darmstadt and other German cities.The descructiDear W.W. & Traubel:â€”I saw our ambitious young friend Sadakichi's photos in an art store in Boston, & the legend beneath it: "Mr Hartmann as he appears in his plays." I have nothing against him that I know of; wish him well, he seems quite a picturesque character; smack of the adventurer; but what of it?I enjoyed very much Mr Traubel's last letter just rec'dreceived.How interesting the magazines are now! We enjoyed, Dear Walt, yryour little bit in the Century, & I am looking with eagerness for the new books.As I understand Horace the Ger.German transl.translation of L of G is out.affec.WS KennedyBelmontMassSept 18/88. William Sloane Kennedy to Walt Whitman and Horace Traubel, 18 September 1888
